Key Match Events: Soto collected three hits and picked up an outfield assist in the Yankees’ 6-5 victory over the Royals in Game 1 of the American League Division Series on Saturday evening.
Pre-Game Insights: Soto said that his relationship with the fans, especially those behind him in right field, has been everything he anticipated.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Soto became the 10th player in franchise history to record three hits in their first postseason game with the Yankees (last achieved by DJ LeMahieu in the 2019 ALDS).
Oswaldo Cabrera is still a neophyte at first base but has one of the league’s best tutors in Anthony Rizzo.

Carlos Rodón authored a strong turnaround in his second season with the Yankees, becoming more unpredictable by mixing in other pitches to complement his fastball/slider combination while maintaining his health and making a career-high 32 starts.
Others: Soto heard among the loudest ovations from a crowd of 48,790 during pre-game introductions, including from one fan in the front row of the right-field seats who waved an oversized blank check in the 25-year-old’s direction.
